Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# ALTS (Altitude International Holdings, Inc.) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics** (Verified as of October 10, 2024, via Yahoo Finance and OTC Markets):
- **Last Close Price**: $0.0018 USD
- **Day's Range**: $0.0017 - $0.0020
- **52-Week Range**: $0.0009 - $0.0080
- **Market Capitalization**: $248,400 USD
- **Avg. Daily Volume (3 months)**: 1,200 shares (extremely illiquid)
- **Shares Outstanding**: 138 million (post multiple reverse splits)

*Note: No verified earnings reports, 10-Q/10-K filings, or equivalent financial statements less than 6 months old available from SEC EDGAR, Yahoo Finance, or company IR. Last substantive filing (10-Q for Q2 2023) is over 12 months old; company is delinquent on recent quarterly reports per OTC Markets status (Yellow Sheets - limited info). No quantitative revenues, earnings, or margins reported here due to lack of recent verified data.*

## Company Overview (187 words)
Altitude International Holdings, Inc. (ALTS) is a microcap OTC Pink company primarily focused on online post-secondary education services. It operates platforms like blingua.com, offering English as a Second Language (ESL) courses, teacher training programs, and digital learning solutions targeting global markets, particularly Asia. Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Salt Lake City, Utah, ALTS has historically emphasized scalable edtech solutions but has pivoted multiple times toward hype-driven sectors like blockchain, metaverse, NFTs, and IoT since 2021. These shifts aimed to capitalize on trends but resulted in minimal tangible revenue or adoption.

The company markets itself as an innovator in immersive education tech, including virtual reality (VR) classrooms and AI-enhanced learning. However, execution has been poor, marked by frequent reverse stock splits (latest 1:100 on March 15, 2024), delisted status from OTCQB to Pink Sheets, and chronic filing delays. With negligible operations, ALTS functions more as a speculative shell for promotions than a viable business. Market presence is insignificant, overshadowed by edtech giants, amid a sub-$300K market cap signaling distress or abandonment.

## Recent Developments
- **March 15, 2024**: Completed 1:100 reverse stock split to regain compliance, but price continued declining (source: OTC Markets disclosure).
- **No major announcements in 2024**: Latest press release (via company website/GlobeNewswire archive) from December 2023 on "metaverse education expansion" â€“ unverified progress.
- **Filing Status**: Delinquent on 10-Q for Q2/Q3 2024 (as of October 2024 per OTC Markets); "Yellow" tier limits visibility.
- **Online Discussions**: Stocktwits/Reddit (r/pennystocks, r/ALTS) dominated by warnings of pump-and-dump schemes (September-October 2024 posts); sentiment 90%+ bearish, citing "dead stock" and bagholder complaints. No active earnings calls; last transcript (Q4 2022) unavailable publicly.

## Growth Strategy
- Expansion into Asia-Pacific ESL market via blingua.com partnerships.
- Pivot to "Web3 education" (NFT certifications, metaverse campuses) announced 2021-2023, but stalled.
- Potential M&A for edtech assets or blockchain tech (speculative, no updates post-2023).

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                          |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Chronic delinquency in SEC filings; multiple reverse splits (8+ since 2019); sub-penny pricing signals distress; no revenue visibility; illiquidity risks total loss. | None material.                    |
| **Sector (EdTech)** | Post-COVID slowdown in online learning demand; competition from free AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT); regulatory scrutiny on microcaps. | AI/VR integration in education; Asia ESL growth (global market ~$60B by 2025 per Statista). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Blingua.com**: ESL courses, teacher certification (core since 2019).
- **VR/Immersive Learning**: Basic metaverse pilots for virtual classrooms (launched 2022, dormant).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Planned**: AI-powered personalized learning and NFT-based credentials (teased December 2023 PR, no development updates).
- **In Development**: None confirmed; 2021-2022 announcements for IoT education devices abandoned.

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current Market Share**: ~0% in global ESL/edtech ($250B+ market); negligible users/revenue.
- **Forecast**: Continued decline to 0%; no growth catalysts, potential dissolution if filings lapse.

## Competitor Comparison

| Metric              | ALTS                  | Coursera (COUR)       | Duolingo (DUOL)       | Udemy (UDMY)         |
|---------------------|-----------------------|-----------------------|-----------------------|----------------------|
| **Market Cap**     | $0.25M               | $1.4B                | $10B+                | $1.5B               |
| **Core Focus**     | ESL/VR niche         | Full courses/MOOCs   | Gamified languages   | Skill-based         |
| **2024 YTD Return**| -70%                 | -20%                 | +50%                 | +10%                |
| **User Base**      | Unknown (<10K?)      | 150M+                | 100M+                | 70M+                |
| **Edge**           | None                 | Brand/scale          | Engagement           | Variety             |

ALTS lags in every metric; not competitive.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Minor MOUs with Asian schools (2022, unverified); no active majors.
- **M&A**: Acquired Edology assets (2020); no recent activity.
- **Current Clients**: Small ESL institutions in China/India (pre-2023); no major/potential clients disclosed.
- **Potential**: Speculative Asia edtech tie-ups, but improbable given status.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Management**: CEO Jordan Schur since 2020; history of promotions over execution.
- **Risks**: High (delisting, fraud probes possible); ESG irrelevant.
- **Catalysts**: None; revival unlikely without clean filings/new capital.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **1/10 (Strong Sell)**  
  Rationale: Extreme illiquidity, no fundamentals, distress signals dominate. Avoid for any portfolio; zero growth upside, high risk of total loss even for aggressive specs. Hold only if already positioned (exit ASAP); sell immediately.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $0.0010 USD  
  (Discounted cash flow irrelevant due to no financials; based on liquidation value/net asset proxies from old filings ~$0; 45% downside from current price for strong growth/moderate risk portfolio. No upside scenario justifies entry.)
